thread.title: Five keys for the Miami Dolphins to defeat the Houston Texans
thread.title_full: Five keys for the Miami Dolphins to defeat the Houston Texans

title: Five keys for the Miami Dolphins to defeat the Houston Texans
text:
Sports Miami Dolphins Five keys for the Miami Dolphins to defeat the Houston Texans Caption It is time for Miami's passing game to flex its muscles by exploiting Houston's battered and bruised secondary Taimy Alvarez / Sun Sentinel 
The Texans will be forced to play without starting cornerback Kareem Jackson, who suffered a left knee injury last week. That means rookie Kevin Johnson and AJ Bouye, a former UCF standout, will likely have their roles elevated. The Dolphins’ top two receivers – Jarvis Landry and Rishard Matthews (18) – are both on pace to produce 1,000 yards receiving seasons, and Ryan Tannehill is finally developing chemistry with deep threat Kenny Stills. 
The Texans will be forced to play without starting cornerback Kareem Jackson, who suffered a left knee injury last week. That means rookie Kevin Johnson and AJ Bouye, a former UCF standout, will likely have their roles elevated. The Dolphins’ top two receivers – Jarvis Landry and Rishard Matthews (18) – are both on pace to produce 1,000 yards receiving seasons, and Ryan Tannehill is finally developing chemistry with deep threat Kenny Stills. (Taimy Alvarez / Sun Sentinel) Caption Keep Texans pass rusher J.J. Watt from harassing Ryan Tannehill Kevin Jairaj / Kevin Jairaj-USA TODAY Sports 
The last time the Dolphins played Houston Watt consistently got into Tannehill’s passing lanes, and made plays in Miami’s backfield that produced turnovers back in that 2012 Dolphins loss. That performance, which happened to be Tannehill’s first regular season start, was the worst statistical game of Tannehill’s career (39 passer rating). It will be interesting to see the growth Tannehill has made 52 starts later, but the Dolphins offensive line can’t let Watt wreck the game plan.

That performance, which happened to be Tannehill’s first regular season start, was the worst statistical game of Tannehill’s career (39 passer rating). It will be interesting to see the growth Tannehill has made 52 starts later, but the Dolphins offensive line can’t let Watt wreck the game plan. (Kevin Jairaj / Kevin Jairaj-USA TODAY Sports) 
Omar Kelly provides the five areas of greatest importance for the Miami Dolphins as they try to get back to .500 and make Dan Campbell the second Dolphins coach to begin his Miami career 2-0: Loading
